# isAffectedByGravity

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that determines whether the constant gravity of a scene accelerates the body.

## Declaration

```swift
var isAffectedByGravity: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] (the default), and the type of the body is [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsBodyType/dynamic], the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsWorld/gravity] property of the scene’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNScene/physicsWorld] object causes the body to accelerate.

If this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the body is not affected by scene gravity. This option can be useful when making physics bodies whose behavior should be governed by [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField] objects instead of a constant global acceleration.

## Defining How Forces Affect a Physics Body

- **physicsShape**: An object that defines the solid volume of the physics body for use in collision detection.
- **type**: A constant that determines how the physics body responds to forces and collisions.
- **SCNPhysicsBodyType**: Constants that determine how a physics body interacts with forces and other bodies, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsBody/type] property and when creating a physics body.
- **velocityFactor**: A multiplier affecting how SceneKit applies translations computed by the physics simulation to the node containing the physics body.
- **angularVelocityFactor**: A multiplier affecting how SceneKit applies rotations computed by the physics simulation to the node containing the physics body.
